subject: junit 4 expected= subclass change
msgSnippet: Hey guys, In junit4 cvs, I noticed the following change:
messageBody:
Hey guys,

In junit4 cvs, I noticed the following change:

http://cvs.sourceforge.net/viewcvs.py/junit/junit/org/junit/internal/runners/Attic/TestMethodRunner.java?r1=1.1.2.5&r2=1.1.2.6&only_with_tag=Version4

which allows the expected exception to be a base class of the actual
one. This differs from the NUnit behavior:

http://nunit.org/index.php?p=exception&r=2.2.6

When writing a test, I usually want to make sure the program throws
the *EXACT* type of exception I specify, not that it throws some
random subclass.

-- Ben
